meanings.definition: To handle or manipulate without the use of gloves or tools.
meanings.sent1: She carefully barehands the delicate flower to avoid damaging it.
meanings.sent2: He prefers to barehand the dough when making bread.
meanings.sent3: In the kitchen, she proudly shows off her ability to barehand ingredients like a pro.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to barehand the cards effortlessly, mesmerizing the audience.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic skillfully barehands the small parts to assemble the machine quickly.

meanings.definition: Using only one's hands without any protective covering.
meanings.sent1: The barehand grip on the monkey bars was challenging for the young child.
meanings.sent2: She felt the rough texture of the rock with her barehand touch.
meanings.sent3: The barehand approach to painting left colorful fingerprints all over the canvas.
meanings.sent4: His barehand strength was evident as he effortlessly lifted the heavy box.
meanings.sent5: The barehand catch by the outfielder amazed the crowd with its precision.
